com.nokia.dempsy.monitoring.coda
Class StatsCollectorFactoryCoda

java.lang.Object
  com.nokia.dempsy.monitoring.coda.StatsCollectorFactoryCoda
All Implemented Interfaces:
StatsCollectorFactory
public class StatsCollectorFactoryCoda
extends Object
implements StatsCollectorFactory

Create a Stats Collector, appropriate for a given cluster, running at a given destination, using the given reporters. The underlying StatsCollector is based on the Metrics package by Coda Hale at Yammer. By default, it will always export statistics to JMX. However, it can also export statistics via a number of periodic reporters. Support for the console, cvs, Graphite, and Ganglia reporters is included in this factory. On creation, the factory will make the stats collector "appropriate" for the cluster. In the case of Graphite and Ganglia, that means adding an appropriate prefix to the statistic names, or an appropriate group name. In both cases a combination of the application, cluster and the receiver endpoint are used to build the string.

setEnvironmentPrefix

public void setEnvironmentPrefix(String envPrefix)
Set the environment prefix. For Graphite, use a '.' at the end of the prefix to create another level of the hierarchy that corresponds to the environment.

setNamingStrategy

public void setNamingStrategy(StatsCollectorFactoryCoda.MetricNamingStrategy namer)
If you want more refined control over the way metrics are defined in various monitoring systems like Ganglia or Graphite the you can implement the StatsCollectorFactoryCoda.MetricNamingStrategy interface and provide an instance to this method. Every createdStatsCollector from that point on will register it's metrics according to the given naming strategy.

getNamingStrategy

public StatsCollectorFactoryCoda.MetricNamingStrategy getNamingStrategy()

createStatsCollector

public StatsCollector createStatsCollector(ClusterId clusterId,
                                           Destination listenerDestination)
Description copied from interface: StatsCollectorFactory
The framework will invoke this method to retrieve the chosen StatsCollector implementation.

Specified by:
createStatsCollector in interface StatsCollectorFactory
Parameters:
clusterId - is the Cluster Id for this cluster. Should be used to categorize the metrics being exposed.
listenerDestination - is the destination for this Node. If this node isn't a destination for messages then this value can be null.
Returns:
the particular StatsCollector implementation the coresponds to this factory.
